doc.problem_description: Create a basic 'Hello World' web page that displays a greeting message and the current date
doc.prd_context: Target audience: Complete beginners learning HTML. Must work on IE11+ and mobile devices. Page load time <2s. Support screen readers for accessibility. Include favicon and proper meta tags for SEO.
doc.design_context: Responsive design using CSS Grid/Flexbox. Color contrast ratio 4.5:1 minimum. Typography: system fonts only. No external dependencies. Progressive enhancement approach. Support offline viewing.
doc.code_context: Vanilla HTML5/CSS3 only. Use semantic elements (header, main, time). Implement CSS custom properties for theming. Include structured data markup. Minify CSS for production. Use BEM naming convention.
doc.quality_context: W3C validation required. Lighthouse score >90. WCAG 2.1 AA compliance. Cross-browser testing on Chrome, Firefox, Safari. Performance budget: <50KB total. Include automated testing setup.

target: Create a basic 'Hello World' web page that displays a greeting message and the current date

gen_args_0.arg_0:
Multi-Turn Software Engineering Task

PRD Context: Target audience: Complete beginners learning HTML. Must work on IE11+ and mobile devices. Page load time <2s. Support screen readers for accessibility. Include favicon and proper meta tags for SEO.
Design Context: Responsive design using CSS Grid/Flexbox. Color contrast ratio 4.5:1 minimum. Typography: system fonts only. No external dependencies. Progressive enhancement approach. Support offline viewing.
Code Context: Vanilla HTML5/CSS3 only. Use semantic elements (header, main, time). Implement CSS custom properties for theming. Include structured data markup. Minify CSS for production. Use BEM naming convention.
Quality Context: W3C validation required. Lighthouse score >90. WCAG 2.1 AA compliance. Cross-browser testing on Chrome, Firefox, Safari. Performance budget: <50KB total. Include automated testing setup.

Problem: Create a basic 'Hello World' web page that displays a greeting message and the current date

You will complete this software engineering project in 3 phases. For each phase, create the required deliverables and save them to the specified locations.

IMPORTANT CONSTRAINTS:
- Maximum 2 iterations per phase (do not over-iterate)
- For testing: Run tests maximum 2 times, partial pass is acceptable
- Focus on functional implementation over perfect test coverage
- Prioritize completion over perfection

PHASE 1: Product Requirements Document (PRD)
Create a concise and precise PRD (max 500 words) covering:
- Problem statement and objectives
- User stories and acceptance criteria
- Functional and non-functional requirements
- Success metrics

Save to: ./output/easy_001/prd.md
Confirm with: "PRD saved to [filepath]"
Iteration limit: Maximum 2 attempts

PHASE 2: Technical Design
Based on your PRD, create a concise and precise technical design (max 500 words) covering:
- System architecture and components
- API specifications and data models
- Technology stack and infrastructure
- Security and scalability considerations

Save to: ./output/easy_001/design.md
Confirm with: "Design saved to [filepath]"
Iteration limit: Maximum 2 attempts

PHASE 3: Implementation
Implement the complete solution as a Python project:
- Create project structure in ./output/easy_001/src/
- Include main modules, classes, and functions
- Add comprehensive tests

Testing guidelines:
- Run tests maximum 2 times
- Partial test pass is acceptable (no need for 100% pass rate)
- Focus on core functionality over comprehensive testing

Confirm with: "Implementation complete in [dirpath]"
Iteration limit: Maximum 2 attempts

Please complete all 3 phases in sequence with the specified constraints:

resps:
Understood. I will complete the 3 phases of the Multi-Turn Software Engineering Task according to the provided requirements and constraints.

Phase 1: Product Requirements Document (PRD)

PRD (max 500 words):

Problem Statement and Objectives:
The goal of this project is to create a basic "Hello World" web page that displays a greeting message and the current date. The target audience is complete beginners learning HTML, and the page must work on IE11+ and mobile devices, with a page load time under 2 seconds. It should also support screen readers for accessibility, include a favicon and proper meta tags for SEO, and meet other quality and performance requirements.

User Stories and Acceptance Criteria:
1. As a user, I want to see a greeting message on the page so that I can understand the purpose of the website.
   - Acceptance Criteria: The page displays a clear and welcoming greeting message.
2. As a user, I want to see the current date on the page so that I can easily reference the date.
   - Acceptance Criteria: The current date is displayed on the page in a readable format.
3. As a user with a screen reader, I want to be able to access the content of the page so that I can fully engage with the website.
   - Acceptance Criteria: The page is screen reader accessible and provides proper semantic markup.

Functional and Non-Functional Requirements:
- The page must display a greeting message and the current date.
- The page must work on IE11+ and mobile devices.
- The page load time must be less than 2 seconds.
- The page must support screen readers for accessibility.
- The page must include a favicon and proper meta tags for SEO.
- The design must use responsive CSS Grid/Flexbox layout.
- The color contrast ratio must be at least 4.5:1.
- The page must use system fonts only, with no external dependencies.
- The page must follow a progressive enhancement approach and support offline viewing.
- The HTML and CSS must be valid and comply with W3C standards.
- The Lighthouse score must be greater than 90.
- The page must be WCAG 2.1 AA compliant.
- The total page size must be less than 50KB.

Success Metrics:
- The page must pass W3C validation.
- The Lighthouse score must be greater than 90.
- The page must be WCAG 2.1 AA compliant.
- The page must work correctly on the target browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari).
- The page load time must be less than 2 seconds.

Saved to: ./output/easy_001/prd.md

Phase 1 complete.
